title: Self-Explanation Promotion Strategies in Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematics curriculum knowledge and understanding of basic pedagogical methods
context.additional_context: A course where pre-service/in-service teachers learn and practice self-regulated explanation techniques applicable to real classroom situations

learning_goals: Learners can design and implement three or more strategies to promote self-regulated explanations during mathematical problem-solving.
Learners can develop five types of structured prompts to elicit qualitative explanations from students.
Learners can integrate three elements—conceptual understanding, procedural knowledge, and error analysis—when designing self-regulated explanation activities.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
